ALGORITHM.Defintion: a set of mathematical instructions or rules that, especially if given to a computer, will help to calculate an answer to a problem

ANYTHING BUT.Defintion: used to mean the opposite of the stated quality

BACK DOWN.Defintion: to admit that you were wrong or that you have been defeated

BIAS.Defintion: the action of supporting or opposing a particular person or thing in an unfair way, because of allowing personal opinions to influence your judgment

BUZZWORD.Defintion: a word or expression from a particular subject area that has become fashionable by being used a lot, especially on television and in the newspapers

COMB.Defintion: to search a place or an area very carefully

CONNECT THE DOTS.Defintion: bringing together information from different places, find a pattern

CREEPY.Defintion: strange or unnatural and making you feel frightened

CYNICS.Defintion: people who believe that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

DEPORT.Defintion: to force someone to leave a country, especially someone who has no legal right to be there or who has broken the law

DOUBLESPEAK.Defintion: language that has no real meaning or has more than one meaning and is intended to hide the truth

EERILY.Defintion: in a strange, frightening, and mysterious way

EROSION.Defintion: the fact of a good quality or situation being gradually lost or destroyed

FRAUDSTER.Defintion: someone who gets money by deceiving people

HARDWARE.Defintion: metal tools, materials, and equipment used in a house or a garden, such as hammers, nails, and screws

IN INVERTED COMMAS.Defintion: used in spoken English after a word or phrase to show that it has not been used accurately or that the opposite meaning is intended

INSIDER TRADING.Defintion: the illegal buying and selling of company shares by people who have special information because they are involved with the company

INTRUSION.Defintion: an occasion when someone goes into a place or situation where they are not wanted or expected to be

LIBERTARIAN.Defintion: a person who believes that people should be free to think and behave as they want and should not have limits put on them by governments

LUCRATIVE.Defintion: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money‍

MONITOR.Defintion: to watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it

OMNIPOTENT.Defintion: having unlimited power and able to do anything

ORB.Defintion: something in the shape of a ball

PIECE TOGETHER.Defintion: if you piece together facts or information, you collect them in order to understand a situation

POSES.Defintion: to cause something, especially a problem or difficulty

SCRATCHING THEIR HEAD.Defintion: to be confused about something, unable to figure it out

SPOKEN OUT.Defintion: to publicly speak in protest about something, especially when protesting could be dangerous

TREASONOUS.Defintion: involving or guilty of the crime of betraying one's country‍

WEIGH UP.Defintion: to think carefully about the advantages or disadvantages of a situation before making a decision

WEIGHTED.Defintion: prepared and arranged in a way that is likely to produce a particular effect, usually an advantage, rather than any other
